message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY 

This paper is about a parallel corpus for machine translation between English and Hindi. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also reports baseline results for phrase-based SMT and NMT translation, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves pre-processing of the corpus for machine translation, which could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. Finally, the paper could also be relevant to cs.CY (Computers and Society) sub-category as it deals with the use of technology for language translation and its impact on society.
